In addition, colleges and universities often have dedicated staff that are responsible for overseeing the welfare of student-athletes, including athletic trainers, academic advisors, and compliance officers. These individuals work closely with student-athletes to ensure that they are receiving the necessary support and resources, including any necessary medical or academic attention.

Moreover, following the recent scandals related to athlete compensation, universities have implemented policies and programs aimed at addressing these issues. Many schools now provide athletic scholarships that cover the full cost of attendance, and some have provided additional financial support to student-athletes, such as stipends for living expenses.

Overall, colleges and universities are continuously implementing and updating policies and programs to ensure the safety and well-being of their student-athletes, and the focus remains on creating a positive, healthy, and inclusive environment for all students, including those participating in athletics programs.
